comments:
To reproduce:
Update eclipse to Eclipse 3.3M6,
create a JAX-WS java first project,
add a java interface and add some methods to the interface,
create web service and web method by selecting JAX-WS > Create Web Service,JAX-WS > Create Web Method, set @WebParam for methods in the interface,
save the file then build,
no WSDL file is generated and there are exceptions in console:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeTypeInfoSetImpl.<init>(RuntimeTypeInfoSetImpl.java:25)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeModelBuilder.createTypeInfoSet(RuntimeModelBuilder.java:89)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeModelBuilder.createTypeInfoSet(RuntimeModelBuilder.java:42)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.ModelBuilder.<init>(ModelBuilder.java:114)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeModelBuilder.<init>(RuntimeModelBuilder.java:49)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.runtime.JAXBContextImpl.getTypeInfoSet(JAXBContextImpl.java:389)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.runtime.JAXBContextImpl.<init>(JAXBContextImpl.java:253)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.ContextFactory.createContext(ContextFactory.java:84)

	at org.eclipse.stp.sc.cxf.generators.CeltixJavaToWsdlGenerator.run(CeltixJavaToWsdlGenerator.java:94)
	at org.eclipse.stp.sc.jaxws.builders.ScJavaToWsdlBuilder.generate(ScJavaToWsdlBuilder.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.stp.sc.jaxws.builders.ScJavaToWsdlBuilder.buildOneJavaFile(ScJavaToWsdlBuilder.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.stp.sc.common.builders.ScJavaBuilder.visitResourceFile(ScJavaBuilder.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.stp.sc.common.builders.ScJavaBuilder.access$0(ScJavaBuilder.java:114)
	at org.eclipse.stp.sc.common.builders.ScJavaBuilder$ScBuildVisitor.visit(ScJavaBuilder.java:173)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource$2.visit(Resource.java:105)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource$1.visitElement(Resource.java:57)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.doIteration(ElementTreeIterator.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTreeIterator.iterate(ElementTreeIterator.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.accept(Resource.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.accept(Resource.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.accept(Resource.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.stp.sc.common.builders.ScJavaBuilder.fullBuild(ScJavaBuilder.java:77)
	at org.eclipse.stp.sc.common.builders.ScJavaBuilder.build(ScJavaBuilder.java:54)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$2.run(BuildManager.java:629)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

The root error for this bug is :

java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraints violated when linking javax/xml/namespace/QName class
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeBuiltinLeafInfoImpl.<clinit>(RuntimeBuiltinLeafInfoImpl.java:186)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeTypeInfoSetImpl.<init>(RuntimeTypeInfoSetImpl.java:25)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeModelBuilder.createTypeInfoSet(RuntimeModelBuilder.java:84)
	at com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.impl.RuntimeModelBuilder.createTypeInfoSet(RuntimeModelBuilder.java:41)


I think there are several places contains the QName class. (jdk 5 rt.jar and one in cxf plugin/stax-api as well). 
The classloader load that class from jdk(not sure.). and load other related class from stax-api package. which caused the link error.

More info:
after enable the verbose:class option for JVM. found out that:
[Loaded javax.xml.namespace.QName from file:/C:/dev/eclipse3.3M6/plugins/org.apache.cxf_2.0-incubator-RC-SNAPSHOT/lib/stax-api-1.0.1.jar]


[Loaded javax.xml.datatype.DatatypeConfigurationException from C:\jdk1.5.0_06\jre\lib\rt.jar]
[Loaded javax.xml.datatype.DatatypeFactory from C:\jdk1.5.0_06\jre\lib\rt.jar]
[Loaded javax.xml.datatype.FactoryFinder from C:\jdk1.5.0_06\jre\lib\rt.jar]

The QName was loaded from stax-api-1.0.1.jar, but other xml classes was loaded from jre/rt.jar. which caused the link problem in jvm.

Fixed by added -Dorg.osgi.framework.bootdelegation=* for eclipse runtime.

The reason is: In Eclipse3.3, the booldelegation has been changed according to OSGIR4 by default.
Thus the javax.xml.namespace.QName is loaded from cxfplugin/lib/stax-api-1.0.1.jar.
But that is different version from Jre/lib/rt.jar.

Which caused the jvm throw LinkError.
By set bootdelegation=*, it will try to load those javax.xml from jre/lib/rt.jar first. So we only have one copy for that class across system

See the reference links below:
http://www.mail-archive.com/osgi-dev@www2.osgi.org/msg00160.html
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=162231

traces.message: loader constraints violated when linking javax/xml/namespace/QName class
